metadata.title: Monocyte-derived Prostaglandin E2 inhibits antigen-specific cutaneous immunity during ageing 2

abstract.original_text: Inflammation resulting from tissue injury blocks antigen-specific cutaneous immunity during 24 ageing. Monocytes recruited to the skin inhibit TRM function through COX2-derived 25 prostaglandin E2 production. Blocking inflammation and resulting prostaglandin E2 26 production with a p38-MAP kinase inhibitor significantly enhances cutaneous antigen-27 specific responses. 28 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

sentences.segment_text: Inflammation resulting from tissue injury blocks antigen-specific cutaneous immunity during 24 ageing .
Monocytes recruited to the skin inhibit TRM function through COX2-derived 25 prostaglandin E2 production .
Blocking inflammation and resulting prostaglandin E2 26 production with a p38-MAP kinase inhibitor significantly enhances cutaneous antigen-27 specific responses .
